column4: Hmm can anyone walk me through creating a ssl x11vnc connection between windows and ubuntu?
do you really need full desktop access or just access to graphical programs?
would like full desktop but what where you thinking re just graphical prog?
Graphical access to linux machines is most intuitive when you tunnel an X connection over ssh imho.
ahh how would I do that?

That will tell you how to get an x server for windows. Then you do what guntbert said and use Putty or another ssh client to connect to your ubuntu machine. When you run graphical programs, the window will open on your windows machine.
yeah I think if thats the word for server
as long as you keep it patched and either use very strong passwords or shared keys
If it's really critical, probably want shared keys or shared keys + password
hmm might want to look into shared keys can you have both a strong pass and shared keys?
Is there a way of making it so that ssh only works inside my local network?
